https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/aeaefb29-232e-40b6-a1f5-37776c6c32a8/MissionMotor_Horizontal_FullColor.png?format=1500w
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/aeaefb29-232e-40b6-a1f5-37776c6c32a8/MissionMotor_Horizontal_FullColor.png?format=1500w
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/8b6d8881-829a-4d84-8cc0-69fb1db496f7/designervn-g945H9TK_2w-unsplash.jpg

The Mission Motor works to increase the adoption of MEL practices within the animal and vegan advocacy community. We offer training and support on Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning to ensure that data gathered through MEL continuously improves processes and interventions, the existing evidence base increases, organizations can make the highest achievable impact.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/1663403284839-BF3N8GTWQ72H1U7BOB35/unsplash-image-SmnnJ0wdE4U.jpg

Changing the world is possible.We’ve done it before. We are happy to share our extensive knowledge and experience on how to set up suitable Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning systems.We love simple, effective processes that support you in achieving success. Whether it concerns creating a theory of change, brainstorming suitable metrics, or designing survey questions, we are here to help.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/1690041318444-J8NOY6JA8PUW3AK4P6GL/image-asset.jpeg

How does it work? Organizations qualify for our support if they implement programs to end intensive animal factory farming are eager to discover if and why their interventions do or do not work have capacity to dedicate time to work with us, and are willing and able to make changes based on the data and insights they collect. We work globally with all types of organizations and interventions. If you meet these criteria and have questions about how to gather reliable data, identify areas for improvement, or test different tactics and strategies, just reach out!We are generally able to address smaller questions at short notice. We work with a waiting list if more support is required. The Mission MotorAccelerating foundations for change Charity status in the NetherlandsRSIN-number: 864226597Chamber of Commerce: 87177722 E-mail: contact@themissionmotor.org Tel: +31 (0)6-21708832 Follow us onLinkedIn Bank: Triodos bank, SWIFT code TRIONL2UAccount number: NL27TRIO 0320 550699 Website created byVegan Hacktivists

https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/aeaefb29-232e-40b6-a1f5-37776c6c32a8/MissionMotor_Horizontal_FullColor.png?format=1500w
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/99f4a4bb-9462-4d0f-aa26-ef5d6dbe0f31/Team+outside+PXL_20240828_100522755.jpg

Concrete and Effective Support Short-term Advice For teams that have specific questions or need advice to overcome hurdles. Examples: “Which tool can I best use to collect information”,  “Do you have a template for collecting stakeholder information”, and “Can you provide feedback on my Theory of Change“? Please send a message to contact@themissionmotor.org if you have MEL-related questions. Longer-term Support For organizations that want to learn how to integrate MEL tools into their standard operating procedures. For several months to a year, we walk through a full MEL cycle together. We will practice using tools such as environmental analysis, evidence review, theory of change, setting up a monitoring system, and survey design. Please send a message to contact@themissionmotor.org if you would like to explore options for longer-term support. MEL Community: Slack & Meet-ups For individuals who would like to know more about MEL and connect with peers in the animal and vegan advocacy community. The Mission Motor team hosts monthly online sessions to present and discuss specific MEL-related topics. The meetings are announced viaLuma, Hive Slack, and ourLinkedInpage. On theHive# MEL sub-Slack channel, you can ask questions to other MEL enthusiasts or our team.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/306f8185-36a5-4b3f-98c5-740154285469/image-asset.jpg
Participants of our first cohort based training.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/b563170b-c9e6-4acd-82da-300d553c5144/Animal+Ethics+logo.jpg

Animal Ethics (Global) Animal Ethicsenvisions a world where all sentient beings are given moral consideration. They promote respect for nonhuman animals through outreach, research, and education. Animal Ethics supports and researches interventions to improve the lives of animals in the wild, such as vaccinations and helping animals in natural disasters, and explores how future technologies will enable us to avoid catastrophic risks and ways technology can be used to help wild animals on a large scale.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/8d4fde9d-40ad-4d81-bd35-dbc06d9fb81d/Animal+Welfare+League.jpg

Animal Welfare League (Ghana) Animal Welfare Leagueis an animal advocacy organization that advocates for animal welfare in Ghana. Their mission is to work with stakeholders, communities and government to promote animal welfare for a better environment and human health. Animal Welfare League implements projects, conducts research and engages in community building. They envision a world where animals are loved, cared for and protected.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/1bd99880-4ec0-4852-bee7-7674c0d099ce/OWA+LogoCuadradoVerdeEN.jpg

Animal Welfare Observatory (Spain) Animal Welfare Observatoryis dedicated to improving the living conditions of animals destined for consumption with the lowest standards of animal welfare. Their mission is to achieve agreements with companies, institutions and stakeholders that positively impact the greatest possible number of animals. AWO envisions a world where intensive animal farming and intensive aquaculture makes way to food production models that respect animal welfare.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/4fdcc8a6-03a7-47ce-bcca-8d661cf89179/Logo+ALI.jpg

Aquatic Life Institute (Global) Aquatic Life Instituteis on a mission to reduce the suffering of the trillions of aquatic animals being farmed and caught in the wild for human consumption each year. They conduct research and advise on aquatic animal welfare. Operating from effective altruism principles, ALI seeks to support and accelerate activities that positively impact aquatic life, focusing on the highest-impact welfare interventions for all aquatic animals on a global scale.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/de89c46e-a855-4b8d-ab92-c636d199fbdc/Logo+eaaw+logo.png

Education for Africa Animal Welfare (East Africa) Education for Africa Animal Welfarefosters and promotes animal welfare management among the people of Tanzania and East Africa. In collaboration with other animal lovers they influence policy, support community empowerment, create strong advocacy groups, and promote attitude and behavioral change through media outlets.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/6ddc9307-ca0b-4c2b-98d4-0fedb1bc3ac8/Material+Innovation+Initiative+Logo.jpg

Material Innovation Initiative (Global) Due to unforeseen circumstances, support is paused.Material Innovation Initiativeis a think tank focused on research, knowledge-sharing, and fostering connections to fast-track the development of environmentally preferable and animal-free materials. They work to cultivate a global market for next-gen materials across the fashion, automotive, and home goods industries.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/82aee118-19cb-4fbf-a7da-731882334669/Sinergia+Animal+Logo.png

Sinergia Animal (Global South) Sinergia Animalis an international animal protection organization working in countries of the Global South to reduce the suffering of farmed animals and promote more compassionate food choices. Sinergia Animal participates with their Indonesia office, where they run cage-free programs, a vegan challenge for individuals, and their Nourishing Tomorrow program which supports schools and local government to adopt a plant-based menu at their dining room.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/d483e469-c416-4426-8b14-031a15ba4f14/VLF+Logo+PNG-02+%281%29.jpg

Vegan Life NGO (Greece) Vegan Life NGOaims to spread the vegan lifestyle in Greece and throughout the world. They carry out all kinds of events, campaigns, and actions with the common goal of defending animal rights, familiarizing the public with the concept of veganism, raising awareness around issues of social justice and environmental protection as well as providing accessible, valid and scientifically documented information about the vegan lifestyle and matters connected to it.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/60fb4458-1032-449c-b747-6600eaa4f047/Freepick+hand+holding+chick.jpg

New applications For one-off MEL-related questions or a need for longer-term support, please email us via contact@themissionmotor.org. We may not have room to accommodate all requests, but we will strive to help as much as possible. We also advise animal and vegan advocacy organizations to join the Hive Slack Channel, where we share content and learnings, and organize online meet-ups for those interested in MEL. Please fill out thisformto join the community The Mission MotorAccelerating foundations for change Charity status in the NetherlandsRSIN-number: 864226597Chamber of Commerce: 87177722 E-mail: contact@themissionmotor.org Tel: +31 (0)6-21708832 Follow us onLinkedIn Bank: Triodos bank, SWIFT code TRIONL2UAccount number: NL27TRIO 0320 550699 Website created byVegan Hacktivists

Meet the driving force behindThe Mission Motor! Our Team

Nicoll Peracha Executive Director Nicoll Peracha is an inspiring bridge builder with 25 years of experience in the international non-profit sector. She holds a law degree and since 2016 has supported numerous organizations in their development. Find out more about Nicoll here:Nicoll Peracha | LinkedIn

Sophie Gulliver MEL Advisor Sophie Gulliver is an evaluation expert in the humanitarian, global development, and animal welfare sector. As an M&E freelance consultant, she works with clients to improve their MEL and impact learning. Find out more about Sophie here:Sophie Gulliver | LinkedIn

Koushik Raghavan MEL Associate Koushik Raghavan has a master’s degree in cancer biology with experience working as a Research, Monitoring, and Evaluations Officer for FIAPO. Before joining The Mission Motor, he was a Research Fellow at AIM Training Program. Find out more about Koushik here:Koushik Raghavan | LinkedIn

Jamie Spurgeon MEL Associate Jamie holds a master’s degree in physics with nanoscience and worked for Animal Charity Evaluators. A.o. managing their Movement Grants program which aims to build the animal advocacy movement by supporting growth in underfunded regions and novel interventions. Find out more about Jamie here:Jamie Spurgeon | LinkedIn

Tom Billington MEL Associate Tom is the Co-founder of Fish Welfare Initiative, an organization focused on improving the welfare of fishes, currently concentrated in India. He is on the board of trustees for Ambitious Impact and has been in the animal movement for 5 years. Find out more about Tom here:Thomas Billington | LinkedIn

Saoirse McGivern Communications Volunteer Saoirse holds a degree in business and management and specialises in project management and communications. Highly passionate about animal welfare and advocacy, she volunteers with The Mission Motor to put those skills to use for a great cause! Find out more about Saoirse here:https://www.linkedin.com/in/saoirse-logan-mcgivern Our Board Members

Michelle Vellinga Chair Legal BoardMichelle is a communications professional holding a master’s degree in health education & promotion. Her passion is to promote healthy behaviours through digital communication with the goal of a better life for people and animals. Find out more about Michelle here:Michelle Vellinga | LinkedIn

Lauren Mee Vice-Chair Legal BoardLauren Mee is the co-founder of Animal Advocacy Careers. She is a strategic advisor to Tälist, the AVA summit and EACN. Prior to AAC she worked as a consultant at a global data intelligence organisation and volunteered for the Good Food Institute and The Humane League. Find out more about Lauren here:Lauren Mee 🔶 | LinkedIn

Katrina Sill Board Member Katrina Sill holds an MPA in Development Practice from Columbia University and is an Associate Director for Innovation for Poverty Action's Right-Fit Evidence Unit. Prior to joining IPA, she was the Impact Division Director at One Acre Fund Tanzania Find out more about Katrina here:Katrina Sill | LinkedIn

Lauri van Oosterom Board Member Lauri has master's degrees in Dutch and Russian history and completed several journalism and communication courses. Lauri volunteers for various animal welfare and sustainability organizations in the Netherlands.Lauri van Oosterom | LinkedIn

Jesse van Elzelingen TreasurerJesse van Elzelingen holds a master’s degree in social and organizational psychology, studied Industrial Management, and recently specialized as an agile/scrum coach. Jesse has experience as a legal advisor for union members, and currently works as Operations Manager and Agile Coach at ProVeg Netherlands. Find out more about Jesse here:https://www.linkedin.com/in/jesse-van-elzelingen-522682a8/ Our Partners and Supporters

AIM Ambitious Impact, the successor of Charity Entrepreurship, is created to help individuals make a large positive difference in the world by assisting them in finding and transitioning to a high-impact career path.
Craigslist Charitable Fund Craigslist Charitable Fundsupports organizations pursuing thoughtful interventions aimed at saving humanity and our planet - by ending the exploitation of animals.

Impactful Animal Advocacy Impactful Animal Advocacyconnects 2000+ passionate advocates committed to making a positive impact for farmed animals. IAA enables The Mission Motor to host the #MEL sub Slack channel, which helps us to build our community of practice.
Animal Ask Animal Asksupports organizations with in-depth, cross-comparative research to support decision making towards the most promising opportunities for animals.

Caryn Ginsberg Caryn Ginsberg, experienced board leader  and founder ofPriority Visions, helps progressive nonprofits and businesses who want to accelerate their results to set strategies and use visuals that move people to action. De Volkskantine - Floris Visser ‘‘Without a large budget, it is difficult to gather people around you with knowledge and experience. There are numerous development programs for commercial start-ups and hardly any for non-profit civil society organizations. That's why I was very happy with The Mission Motor. I found a sparring partner who does have professional knowledge and experience but does not focus on achieving as much profit as possible. The support of The Mission Motor gave me more overview and structure, and more confidence in my own work. It is very nice to regularly discuss professional issues and to sorth them out together.’’ The Mission MotorAccelerating foundations for change Charity status in the NetherlandsRSIN-number: 864226597Chamber of Commerce: 87177722 E-mail: contact@themissionmotor.org Tel: +31 (0)6-21708832 Follow us onLinkedIn Bank: Triodos bank, SWIFT code TRIONL2UAccount number: NL27TRIO 0320 550699 Website created byVegan Hacktivists

Thanks to the bi-weekly consultations with Nicoll, I was able to plan my week well, I gained focus and I achieved successful results. Create the future! Non-profit organizations play a crucial role in bringing about a positive change in the world. To induce this positive change effectively, young nonprofits need advice and training. Unfortunately, many lack the financial resources to hire support. The Mission Motor provides support free of charge, so non-profits can quickly and effectively design and implement alternatives to harmful practices and advocate for a more sustainable world.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/1695157244768-GJFGH0S135RDZXU6PIJN/image-asset.jpeg

Support the MEL Community of Practice We are building a community of practice consisting of organizations, trainers, and funders, who will provide (peer) support and act as role models. Through online meetings and the IAA Slack-platform, The Mission Motor will fuel interaction between people interested in MEL.Together we will share best practices and gain knowledge on how to advance MEL within the vegan and animal advocacy domain, andcreate an environment for continuous learning and improvement. Send us a message to join this Community of Practice, or support its creation by inviting us to your podcast or speak at your animal and vegan advocacy conference.
https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/62dbd7d5e2512d7fdad1729c/0c9e824b-3371-49a2-8f56-67ac76324646/hand+holding+pig+figurine+1200060-pxhere.com.jpg

Donate If you are passionate about reinforcing non-profits fighting for a sustainable future free of factory farming with sufficient food for all, consider donating to The Mission Motor! You can support the Dutch or international project, by donating via Triodos bank, SWIFT code TRIONL2U, account number NL27 TRIO 0320 5506 99 in the name of Stichting The Mission Motor, or via PayPal.Every contribution, no matter how small or large, brings us closer to our goal: a strong and impactful non-profit sector working towards a more sustainable world!

Get in touch If you would like more information, or want to discuss the best possibilities to support The Mission Motor, please send me a message. I look forward to meeting you. Stichting Ondersteuning Dierencoalitie - Sandra Beuving ‘‘In 2021 I switched from Public Affairs Manager to Director of Stichting Ondersteuning Dierencoalitie. The work of a director brought with it new and unknown topics. The development of the foundation which was just a few months old, came on top of that. I enjoy a challenge but was very happy with all the help that The Mission Motor offered me. I received support in setting up my foundation, received practical tips and tricks, and immediately applicable tools and templates. This way I could get started quickly and effectively and make a lot of progress. I didn't have to waste energy figuring out all kinds of organizational matters.’’ The Mission MotorAccelerating foundations for change Charity status in the NetherlandsRSIN-number: 864226597Chamber of Commerce: 87177722 E-mail: contact@themissionmotor.org Tel: +31 (0)6-21708832 Follow us onLinkedIn Bank: Triodos bank, SWIFT code TRIONL2UAccount number: NL27TRIO 0320 550699 Website created byVegan Hacktivists
